trans-unit.source: Creates a fully transparent icon with the specified width, height, and color depth

seg-source.mrk: Creates a fully transparent icon with the specified width, height, and color depth

target.mrk: Creates a fully transparent icon with the specified width, height, and color depth

trans-unit.source: The width, in pixels, of the icon.

seg-source.mrk: The width, in pixels, of the icon.

target.mrk: The width, in pixels, of the icon.

trans-unit.source: The height, in pixels, of the icon.

seg-source.mrk: The height, in pixels, of the icon.

target.mrk: The height, in pixels, of the icon.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The number of bits-per-pixel in the XOR bitmask of the icon. Default is 32.

seg-source.mrk: The number of bits-per-pixel in the XOR bitmask of the icon.

target.mrk: The number of bits-per-pixel in the XOR bitmask of the icon.

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

trans-unit.source: This function creates an icon with black XOR, and white AND bitmask bitmaps.

seg-source.mrk: This function creates an icon with black XOR, and white AND bitmask bitmaps.

target.mrk: This function creates an icon with black XOR, and white AND bitmask bitmaps.

trans-unit.source: This icon has no alpha channel, it will be displayed only by using its AND bitmask.

seg-source.mrk: This icon has no alpha channel, it will be displayed only by using its AND bitmask.

target.mrk: This icon has no alpha channel, it will be displayed only by using its AND bitmask.

trans-unit.source: When you are finished using the icon, destroy it using the _WinAPI_DestroyIcon() function.

seg-source.mrk: When you are finished using the icon, destroy it using the _WinAPI_DestroyIcon() function.

target.mrk: When you are finished using the icon, destroy it using the _WinAPI_DestroyIcon() function.
